channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Former NATO chief on Europe and U.S. relations
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Anders Fogh Rasmussen, former prime minister of Denmark and former head of NATO, ahead of the Munich Security Conference.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Anders Fogh Rasmussen, former prime minister of Denmark and former head of NATO, ahead of the Munich Security Conference.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ryan

item.title: Mothers in the U.S. use crowdfunding tactics to help families in war-torn Gaza
item.description: After connecting through social media, an informal network of moms started crowdfunding to help families in Gaza afford food and shelter.
item.content:encoded: After connecting through social media, an informal network of moms started crowdfunding to help families in Gaza afford food and shelter.
item.dc:creator: Beenish Ahmed

item.title: Pakistan-Afghanistan border closures paralyze trade along a key route
item.description: Trucks have been stuck at the closed border since October. Both countries are facing economic losses with no end in sight. The Taliban also banned all Pakistani pharmaceutical imports to Afghanistan.
item.content:encoded:
Trucks have been stuck at the closed border since October. Both countries are facing economic losses with no end in sight. The Taliban also banned all Pakistani pharmaceutical imports to Afghanistan.

(Image credit: ABDUL MAJEED)
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: Reporter's notebook: A Dutch speedskater and a U.S. influencer walk into a bar …
item.description: NPR's Rachel Treisman took a pause from watching figure skaters break records to see speed skaters break records. Plus, the surreal experience of watching backflip artist Ilia Malinin.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Rachel Treisman took a pause from watching figure skaters break records to see speed skaters break records. Plus, the surreal experience of watching backflip artist Ilia Malinin.

(Image credit: David J. Phillip)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: In Beirut, Lebanon's cats of war find peace on university campus
item.description: The American University of Beirut has long been a haven for cats abandoned in times if war or crisis, but in recent years the feline population has grown dramatically.
item.content:encoded:
The American University of Beirut has long been a haven for cats abandoned in times if war or crisis, but in recent years the feline population has grown dramatically.

(Image credit: Tamara Saade for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Britain's PM faces calls to resign over former ambassador's ties to Epstein
item.description: Britain's prime minister is facing calls to resign for naming a friend of Jeffrey Epstein as ambassador to the U.S. Police are also investigating if the king's brother passed trade secrets to Epstein.
item.content:encoded: Britain's prime minister is facing calls to resign for naming a friend of Jeffrey Epstein as ambassador to the U.S. Police are also investigating if the king's brother passed trade secrets to Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Cuban fuel shortage: U.S. blockade of oil grounds flights in Cuba
item.description: Cuba's fuel shortage hits during peak tourist season, grounding flights as the Trump administration's pressure tightens the island's oil supplies.
item.content:encoded: Cuba's fuel shortage hits during peak tourist season, grounding flights as the Trump administration's pressure tightens the island's oil supplies.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Israel passes measure to make purchasing real estate from Palestinians easier
item.description: The Israeli government has passed measures to ease West Bank land purchases for settlers and strengthen control in the occupied territory
item.content:encoded: The Israeli government has passed measures to ease West Bank land purchases for settlers and strengthen control in the occupied territory
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Venezuelans test limits of new freedoms
item.description: Weeks after Nicolás Maduro's ousting, Venezuelans stage protests and vigils to release political prisoners, as the country's Congress prepares to vote on an amnesty law.
item.content:encoded:
Weeks after Nicolás Maduro's ousting, Venezuelans stage protests and vigils to release political prisoners, as the country's Congress prepares to vote on an amnesty law.

(Image credit: Pedro Mattey)
item.dc:creator: Manuel Rueda

item.title: Trump is threatening to block a new bridge between Detroit and Canada from opening
item.description: President Trump on Monday threatened to block the opening of a new Canadian-built bridge across the Detroit River, in his latest salvo over cross-border trade issues.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump on Monday threatened to block the opening of a new Canadian-built bridge across the Detroit River, in his latest salvo over cross-border trade issues.

(Image credit: Paul Sancya)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
